questions.question: Who said, 'The only way to do great work is to love what you do'?
questions.explanation: Steve Jobs, co-founder of Apple Inc., said, 'The only way to do great work is to love what you do'.

questions.question: Who said, 'In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on'?
questions.explanation: Robert Frost, an American poet, said, 'In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on'.

questions.question: Who said, 'The only thing we have to fear is fear itself'?
questions.explanation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, the 32nd President of the United States, said, 'The only thing we have to fear is fear itself'.

questions.question: Who said, 'Be the change that you wish to see in the world'?
questions.explanation: Mahatma Gandhi, the leader of India's independence movement, said, 'Be the change that you wish to see in the world'.

questions.question: Who said, 'Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans'?
questions.explanation: John Lennon, a member of the Beatles, said, 'Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans'.

questions.question: Who said, 'Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts'?
questions.explanation: Winston Churchill, the former British Prime Minister, said, 'Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts'.

questions.question: Who said, 'Imagination is more important than knowledge'?
questions.explanation: Albert Einstein, the renowned physicist, said, 'Imagination is more important than knowledge'.

questions.question: Who said, 'Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that'?
questions.explanation: Martin Luther King Jr., a prominent civil rights leader, said, 'Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that'.

questions.question: Who said, 'The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall'?
questions.explanation: Nelson Mandela, the former President of South Africa, said, 'The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall'.

questions.question: Who said, 'It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop'?
questions.explanation: Confucius, a Chinese philosopher, said, 'It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop'.
